meanings.definition: A small cube with each side having a different number of spots on it, ranging from one to six, used in games of chance.
meanings.sent1: During the game, we rolled the dice to see who would go first.
meanings.sent2: She shook the dice in her hand before throwing them onto the board.
meanings.sent3: The dice rolled off the table and onto the floor, causing everyone to laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dice seemed to have a mind of their own, landing on the number needed for victory.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the dice hitting the wooden surface echoed through the room.

meanings.sent1: I need to dice the vegetables for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The chef carefully dices the onions for the soup.
meanings.sent3: He tried to dice the meat quickly but ended up making uneven cuts.
meanings.sent4: The recipe calls for dicing the tomatoes before adding them to the sauce.
meanings.sent5: She watched as he expertly diced the potatoes with precision.

meanings.definition: To play or gamble with dice.
meanings.sent1: We decided to dice for who would buy the next round of drinks.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, people would gather in taverns to dice and wager their earnings.
meanings.sent3: The friends gathered around the table to dice for the last slice of pizza.
meanings.sent4: He always seemed to have luck on his side when dicing for money.
meanings.sent5: The group of players cheered as the dice revealed the winner of the game.
